content.label: This is my favorite game on Apple Arcade! Can‚Äôt wait to see a 3rd game

title.label: Controller makes the game a million times better

content.label: I originally played this game in the Apple TV, and I had to use a controller. I used the Steelseries Controller, and it was really fun. I decided to get it on my phone, and didn‚Äôt need to use a controller, but trust me, it makes your life a million times easier, and more fun. This game is probably my favorite game in a long while, and it will be played over and over again with New Game + to try and get 100% completion on hardest difficulty with the highest-level gear, be a  us e the grinding isn‚Äôt super long and boring, and you are suggested to do t he main quest, but I think the side quests are more fun after you beat the game once (which only takes about 6 total hours of gameplay, which isn‚Äôt technically the end yet). Overall, it‚Äôs an amazing game, a game you should DEFINITELY get, even if you didn‚Äôt play the first (I didn‚Äôt)!
This game rocks. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

This game was awesome gentlebro people I can‚Äôt wait for the next game to come out cat quest three man I can‚Äôt waitt. The game was also way better than last time also will there be a third person? Suggestions like fox, and racoon. So when it comes out three people can play on Nintendo switch Apple Arcade xbox pc and many more we will support youüòÅü¶äüê±üê∂

Trying though one bad Arcade game after the other, I was about to return the two controllers we bought for couch multiplayer on the ATV - until I tried this one!

Great gameplay, beautiful graphics, fun dialogues / characters, and it works perfectly with two controllers!
I beat the game and I love it it it has such a good ending and also I found out a way to get the jester armor

I can't believe I'm about to say "the cat game is really good". The story line is silly, but the game play is incredible. It's a ligit RPG. It has that right balance of simple controls, yet is intricate enough to be interesting. It's a dungeon crawling, action RPG.  I find this game is unique because the battles in the world map play the same as the battles in the dungeons. Which is great, because the battles are fun.  These battles don't feel like work. I'm really impressed. I hope to see the platform in future games. Good job to the developers; I look forward to your future projects.
I played the original a few years ago and absolutely loved it. Somehow, this manages to be just as good if not better. The combat is easy to learn and the story is amazing.

This game is so much fun. Life changes and I just can‚Äôt spend four hours a night in a raiding guild, but this has just the right balance of difficulty and challenge that I can pick up and put down as needed to get my fix. I‚Äôm fully decked out in the three legendary items and yet I still find myself coming back for more. This is the first RPG on iOS to get the touch interface right so that it doesn‚Äôt require a controller and works on a smaller screen, but it‚Äôs not just a smash tanking game either. Range DPS gameplay is very well done and I found it more intuitive. There is a ton of content to play through, making this a prime example of the quality available via Apple Arcade.
I have been playing this game fur hours nonstop into the knight. What‚Äôs not to like about this pawsome game? Nothing! It‚Äôs purrfect!
this game was not extremely long but it was definitely worth my time üòÄ
Really, my only complaint about this game was that after you beat the game once, there wasn‚Äôt much challenge left, but with new game +, it‚Äôs more fun

Easily the best game in Apple Arcade currently.  Excellent quality and gameplay.  Story line is lighthearted and extremely punny.  RPG is easy, but fits very well for a phone-based game where you may not have lots of time to play in one sitting. Leveling, side quests, story, controls, customization, etc are also just the right amount for a light mobile game that can also give you hours of enjoyment.

So, luckily, I read through the reviews and found out that MFi controller support DOES exist (for mobile devices) ‚Äî thing is, you have to go into the options and switch to controller mode. And, with that, comes the annoying part... you have to perform this action EVERY. TIME. YOU. START. THE. GAME. üòë 

A minor ‚Äúgripe‚Äù, but this game is truly enjoyable, nonetheless. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Should add controller support that would be lit

title.label: Fun game all way through but a few kinks

content.label: Ive finished everything but there is still a spot or two i cant reach, not sure why. But lvl 100sh is a fun game all way through. Recommend for best rpgs on apple games so far

title.label: I 100% The Game...so here‚Äôs my thought

content.label: Wonderful experience. To the Founder Island Easter egg, to all the end game bosses, to the main story twist. I enjoyed every minute. Even with all the cat/dog puns. Cheesy as they were still a great time.

i love the game, but once you finish it, there is nothing more to do (for me). This is my idea of adding holiday updates. Like when its christmas, you can add exclusive items, and a little map change, and new quests. (this would also go for halloween). But this is my suggestion. you don't HAVE to do this. it's just my idea
Everything that was great about Cat Quest 1 is still here, but there‚Äôs about twice as much content. Highly recommended.
My only hissue  is that it seemed shorter than CQ1. But fur real, this game is the cat‚Äôs meow and I hope to see an expansion pack in the future üò∏

title.label: You can‚Äôt play coop with different phones

content.label: It seems like you need to connect 2 controllers in one device. It defeats the purpose of mobile gaming.
This is one of the best games that I‚Äôve ever played on the App Store. I played Co-op and my cousin and I couldn‚Äôt put the game down till we beat it! It has a great storyline. Just PLAY IT

title.label: A (almost) full sized action RPG adventure

content.label:
Cat quest II really feels like a full sized title at first, the controls are great with touch and even better with a controller. It‚Äôs not the deepest RPG but easy to jump in and play for minute bursts.

The only downside comes from a bit of lack of variety, as the game weights a bit long on tooth without much meaningful change. You‚Äôll crawl the same style dungeons and fight the same handful of enemies and the same few enemy attacks from beginning to end. Then the payoff is one unique panel, not much of a close out with an advert for a sequel. I liked the game play but mostly I ended up just using a wand from afar, rolling away and healing whenever hurt. With only two weapon types, there‚Äôs not much toy with. The few pieces of music and SFX are also become a bit worn by the end. There‚Äôs a few secrets, one of which was pretty funny as it gave me pause for a second before agreeing.

That said, this is easily one of the better games in the Apple Arcade roster,  that really gives a small screen a big feel. It‚Äôs easy to list the short comings but Cat Quest II makes for the best of the Apple Arcade and ultimately one of the best mobile games.

Hopefully more larger titles like this are on Apple Arcade, and hopefully they‚Äôll fund even bigger and more expansive games like Cat Quest.

This game is beautifully made and a lot of fun. Though i want to play together with my friend, but she lives in CA and i live in PA.... Please add cross-platform online coop!! she plays on a Switch and I play on iPad Pro. this would be so great to have.

title.label: Great game, marred by terrible input lag on tvOS

content.label: I loved Cat Quest 1, and from the first 20 levels or so, this seems like another great game.  Unfortunately playing co-op on AppleTV 4K with a pair of PS4 controllers will regularly give such terrible input lag as to make the game unplayable (or at least unenjoyable, as we die while hitting buttons to no avail).  I hope an update can fix this, but I do worry that it could just be the AppleTV hardware isn‚Äôt able to deal with everything going on in the game.

title.label: Sad that it came to an end...

content.label:
An ameowzing game. Soundtracks and art are very cute and I have affection for cats and dogs because I like cats but own a dog. The game‚Äôs not grindy, but it‚Äôll be a little bit hard to just skip thru the main story.

I just hope that we have a bigger map and a longer story with Cat Quest III... looking forward to it.

title.label: Loved first game, this one much harder

content.label:
Was a huge fan of CQ1 and played it to death.  This game is much harder and didn‚Äôt give the same kind of fun/casual experience.  Enemies have tons of HP and can wipe you out in 3-4 hits.  NPC buddy never heals or shields at appropriate times, and also doesn‚Äôt seem to contribute much damage.

Would love for CQ2 to be balanced more similarly to CQ1, but for now I don‚Äôt have the patience to slowly carve away at enemies while frantically dodge rolling several times per second.

I started this game on my iPad before Arcade launched on Apple TV. It syncs to my phone but not Apple TV. Other games sync to Apple TV and it‚Äôs more fun to use a controller that way. 
 I emailed their support and they never replied. They updated the game a week later saying they fixed sync issues but they didn‚Äôt fix this. 
 I don‚Äôt want to start over and I don‚Äôt want to be restricted to playing this on iPad, so I have stopped playing it altogether. Maybe I will come back to this game if I can continue the game I started on Apple TV, but they never responded and so many more great games are being released, so maybe I won‚Äôt ever play it again.

Character level and dungeon level have no correlation. For example, my level 18 fighters are getting destroyed in a level 12 dungeon, and this has been my experience throughout the game. A beautifully-illustrated app, ruined by awful mechanics.

I‚Äôm having lots of fun playing this game! However, there is a bug in the quest ‚ÄúFur the Mother‚Äù. I chase the NPC into a dungeon. Once you chase him the back of the dungeon he teleports to the entrance and leaves. The camera stays on him even after he leaves and it won‚Äôt progress to allow me to follow. Please fix ASAP! I would love to complete this game!

Update: Not long after this review I received a reply from the devs saying the bug had been patched in this latest update. It‚Äôs great to have such communication. Amazing game! Keep up the good work!

This is a wonderfully adorable RPG. The gameplay is simple, but still engaging and entertaining. The world is vast, with a lot of quests. The leveling balance is spot on. In addition, if you are looking for a co-op game, playing this on Apple TV with two controllers makes for a great experience. Classes are based on item/ability equips, so you and your partner can change your play style whenever you want.

I‚Äôve been playing this game ever since it came out in mobile. And it‚Äôs been pretty great, the storyline is good, bit cliche, but that‚Äôs whatever.
Graphics are phenomenal ever since the first game, Cat Quest 1.
 Controls are like any controls, and if you have played Cat Quest 1, it‚Äôll be just like it.
Although I haven‚Äôt used a controller, but I personally have heard it‚Äôs better.

Anyway, I do suggest playing this marvelous game. It‚Äôs amazing for a fanatic rpg player. And if it‚Äôs your first time, enjoy it! It‚Äôll be worth it, some trials like; Cathulu, and the game devs are challenging but, are beatable in a certain level and all the achievements are achievable.

Just a hint for people whom are going to play it, try to get the Golden Key as fast as you can! 
But, that‚Äôs it. This game was really fun and entertaining, I hope the devs see this and give themselves a pat on the back. 

Enjoy the game! And have a great time :D
Once you get to the part where you fight the clowns and the lion the rest after that is really hard but it is a really fun game and it‚Äôs also my favorite mobile game I ever played

I honestly haven‚Äôt had any games i liked playing in a while but this game was really fun. Also the story is great its just crazy and all the plot twist make it even better. The only thing is that I feel like the game is really short.

title.label: Why can‚Äôt we play co-op on phone?

content.label: It say multiplayers on the description but it didn‚Äôt say we need to have a MFi controller to do it. What‚Äôs the purpose of an mobile game when we need a separate controller to play together with others?

Overall I really love this game. I play it everyday, and I have fun with it. I don't know if I'm just bad at this game, if it's just super hard. I found a bunch of difficult things about this. Like maybe the Kings are to hard to fight, or the little bats, and orb things that shoot more orbs and have wings (lol sorry) those are super over powered or again I'm just bad. Anyways the game it very fun I I love it so far!

I just finished the game it is sooooo good!!!! (I found out the problem to my review, im just bad) I really need another Cat quest STAT!!!

I have played this with my wife (neither of us are into games that much) on Apple TV and we‚Äôve finished the game over about 10 evenings.

It was such a blast. Thank you Gentlebros and Apple Arcade, we loved every bit of this, including the numerous hidden challenges and easer eggs.

We‚Äôre now waiting patiently for CatQuest III!

title.label: One of the BEST iOS game evah for 2019!

content.label: I never knew about cat quest until Apple Arcade intros it. Cute graphics with a colorful world! Just sad that it‚Äôs so short! Very fun with a lot of ‚Äòpun‚Äôny dialogues. Love it so much! Challenging yet so rewarding after beating a lonely monster in a cave. Although the indicators for new caves, completed caves, incomplete caves were a bit confusing. And the map view is a bit hard to find caves that are not yet completed. Totally great playing with a controller (and with a friend). A worth-it game to play.
This game is awesome.  It has so many pop culture references and it is super fun.  I like how you have the freedom to go into caves and attempt to raid them even if they are 80 levels above your own.
Love it, we need more games focused on players sharing the same screen.

It‚Äôs beautful. It‚Äôs clever. It‚Äôs exquisitely polished. Combat is easy to get started with but has some depth. You can have fun in five minute bursts or in two-hour sessions. Player two can drop in and drop out at any time.

I‚Äôd like better inventory management and better save syncing.It‚Äôs not purrfect. But it‚Äôs close.
Fun, great graphics. However it‚Äôs too difficult to use touch screen, borderlining impossible with the iPad without a controller.
The game is awesome but spell casting without a controller is super hard
One of the best I have playec

I loathe the script's _pun_tification, but credit where due:  this is an admirably approachable, satisfyingly strategic, well-structured open-world story-based action-RPG with oodles of just-because world-building and gaming goodness (that I won't spoil).  I'd even go so far as to say its quest structure is better and more flexible than Breath of the Wild's.  I 100%-ed this game virtually in 1 sitting, and even the ultra-hard end-game felt fresh and fun because it gave late unlocks a chance to really shine.  I eagerly await the 3rd one and hope when it's good and ready it comes to Arcade.

BTW, I played touchscreen only and got along fine but that's probably because I was on iPad.

Found the game a breeze, but you can‚Äôt brute force your way through the content (which is good.) Beat every mob severely under leveled barring the level 200 ‚Äúboss‚Äù, which you don‚Äôt even have to actually fight to get the two stand alone chest. Love the game, and love the fact it rewards people who meta game. Cannot wait for the next installment.
This game is an instant classic! It one of the games that sets the tone for Apple Arcade. Console level story, quality, and game size! True pleasure to play w/ a controller!
Make a cat quest 3 plz
The touch controls are absolutely awful - all of the emersion is lost by having to place your fingers over enemies and your character to commit any actions. Completely obstructs all of the visuals.

Smooth gameplay
Attractive graphics
Super fun gameplay and progression
